data.title: Here's a look at what the original High School Musical cast are up to now
data.meta_description: High School Musical's 2008 release became an instant hit for Disney, drawing in almost eight million viewers and three million soundtrack copies sold.
data.text:
The recent season four release of High School Musical: The Musical: The Series saw the return of some of the original stars.

The original film followed a group of high schoolers as they vied for leading roles in their high school musical.

Gabriella Montez (played by Vanessa Hudgens) was forced to overcome her shyness and Troy Bolton (Zac Efron) had to defy his dad's expectations he'd be a basketball star.

As famous faces were noticeably missing from the spin-off, the 2008 release was a major career starter as many of the stars went on to find success in Hollywood.

While others left the spotlight, Daily Express US has all you need to know about where the cast is now.

READ MORE: Where is the cast of Freaky Friday, and will there be a sequel

Troy Bolton - Zac Efron

Prior to playing the basketball heartthrob, Efron had minor roles in CSI: Miami and The Guardian before landing the major breakout role and becoming a teen sensation.

After his successful portrayal of Troy Bolton, the now 35-year-old became a household name and went on to star in Hairspray, 17 Again, and The Greatest Showman.

In a 2021 interview with Men’s Journal, Efron admitted he found it difficult to branch out from teen films stating: “I was, like, 17. And I said, 'Guys, you know this is not at all what I want to do?'" he shared. "And they were like, 'Really?'"

The actor has since gone on to take on more serious portrayals including Ted Bundy in Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile.

Alongside his upcoming role as pro wrestler Kevin Von Erich in The Iron Claw, Efron also received a Daytime Emmy Award for his Netflix travel docuseries Down to Earth with Zac Efron.

Gabriella Montez - Vanessa Hudgens

After gaining stardom as the academically inclined newbie at East High, Hudgens continued her venture into Hollywood and starred in more Disney Channel shows.

She then embarked on a music career and released two albums with the 2008’s Identified peaking at 28 on the Billboard 200 charts.

Hudgens then made her Broadway debut in the titular role of the 2015 musical production of Gigi.

The actress has since made several business ventures as the co-founder of Cali-Water, KNOW Beauty and the Thomas Ashbourne Craft Spirits.

Hollywood execs push AI Robot future with $900k positions despite actors strike [INSIGHT]

Haunted Mansion review - Rosario Dawson has been robbed [REVIEW]

Sharpay Evans - Ashley Tisdale

Tisdale was used to the limelight as she had already been acting on Disney’s The Suite Life of Zac and Cody as Maddie Fitzpatrick.

While High School Musical propelled her career further, she stayed behind the screens and instead lent her voice to the animated series, Phineas and Ferb as their irritable older sister Candace.

As well as other shows including Sabrina: Secrets of a Teenage Witch, American Dad!, and Ginger Snaps.

Tisdale then featured as a judge on The Masked Singer after releasing three albums.

However, after getting married to musician Christian French and giving birth to daughter Jupiter Iris, she turned her attention to interior design with her business Frenshe Interiors.

Monique Coleman - Taylor McKessie

Throughout High School Musical, Coleman starred as Gabriella’s best friend Taylor and captain of the scholastic decathlon team.

Prior to the film, she had appeared in several small roles on shows such as Gilmore Girls, Boston Public, Veronica Mars, and as Mary Margaret on The Suite Life of Zack and Cody.

In 2006, Coleman went on to star in Dancing with the Stars and finished in fourth place in the competition.

As well as her acting career, she is also credited for her behind-the-scenes work as the producer of her own documentary series called Gimme MO.

The 42-year-old reprised her role as Taylor for the final season of High School Musical: The Musical: The Series.

High School Musical: The Musical: The Series is available to stream on Disney Plus in the USA.
